intro: Corylus avellana var. retusa, commonly known as the horned hazel, is a variant of the hazelnut tree native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, horn-like projections on the nuts, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, deciduous leaves that are alternate and ovate in shape. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers a temperate climate. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible nuts.
